headline: As Cava, Chipotle Sink, Left-for-Dead Rivals Stage Comeback
summary: Shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc., Cava Group Inc. and Sweetgreen Inc. — hot names in what had been a booming fast-casual segment — have each sunk around 20% or more since reporting lackluster second-quarter earnings.  Casual-dining chains are posting strong sales growth that is suddenly rekindling investor interest in a business that many had condemned in recent years to a slow demise.  Wall Street is taking notice: shares of Cheesecake Factory Inc. — known for massive portions and over-the-top decor — are up nearly 29% this year, more than tripling the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Can McDonald's (MCD) Virtual World Advance Its Digital Strategy or Is It Just a Novelty?
summary: Earlier this month, McDonald's launched McDonaldland VR, an interactive digital universe featuring classic characters, themed worlds, and mini-games, accessible through Meta Quest and Web VR, tied to the new McDonaldland Meal. This move introduces an innovative layer of digital engagement, aiming to boost brand connection and customer loyalty by blending entertainment with the dining experience. We’ll explore how McDonaldland VR’s immersive platform could enhance McDonald’s digital commerce...

headline: McDonald's cuts prices as US consumers feel the pinch: WSJ
summary: STORY: McDonald’s is cutting prices in the U.S. as consumers rein in spending.That was according to the Wall Street Journal on Wednesday.The news follows weeks of discussions with restaurant operators concerned about the change.It reportedly sees the company offer financial support to franchisees if they agree to drop prices.The move is meant to win back diners worn down by economic woes.McDonald’s will now discount eight popular combo meals by 15%. The Journal says it will also offer $5 breakfasts and $8 Big Mac and McNugget meal deals later this year.They will be marketed as Extra Value Meals.The company declined to offer a comment on the report.McDonald’s has already benefited from its existing affordable meal bundles.Earlier this month, they helped it beat Wall Street estimates for second quarter sales.Rivals including Domino’s Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands have also been doubling down on value meals.The fast food industry has been battling to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among lower-income families.

raw.headline: McDonald's cuts prices as US consumers feel the pinch: WSJ
raw.summary: STORY: McDonald’s is cutting prices in the U.S. as consumers rein in spending.That was according to the Wall Street Journal on Wednesday.The news follows weeks of discussions with restaurant operators concerned about the change.It reportedly sees the company offer financial support to franchisees if they agree to drop prices.The move is meant to win back diners worn down by economic woes.McDonald’s will now discount eight popular combo meals by 15%. The Journal says it will also offer $5 breakfasts and $8 Big Mac and McNugget meal deals later this year.They will be marketed as Extra Value Meals.The company declined to offer a comment on the report.McDonald’s has already benefited from its existing affordable meal bundles.Earlier this month, they helped it beat Wall Street estimates for second quarter sales.Rivals including Domino’s Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands have also been doubling down on value meals.The fast food industry has been battling to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among lower-income families.
